newsitem.title: SRI LANKA: Sri Lanka rupee ends up despite dollar demand.
newsitem.headline: Sri Lanka rupee ends up despite dollar demand.

text.p: The Sri Lanka rupee was untroubled by import cover demand for dollars and closed higher on the back of rising call money rates, dealers said.
The rupee closed at 57.07 to the dollar after opening at 57.13. The currency closed at 57.16 on Monday.
"If not for import covering which cushioned the dollar's downward movement, the rupee would have risen further," said a Standard Chartered Bank dealer.
Import covering demand for dollars pushed the rupee down to a maximum of 57.06, he said.
Overnight call money closed at 22 percent after reaching a high of 23 as a number of big borrowers entered the market, dealers said.
Banks covering imports with dollars from the Central Bank, and government drawing on treasury accounts in state banks, led to the tight money situation, they said.
